text:
Raskolnikov stepped outside, lost in thought. 

“Here he is himself!” shouted the porter. 

Raskolnikov looked up. A short man stood nearby. 

“What is it?” he asked, approaching the porter. 

The man glanced at him, then turned and left. 

“Why did he ask for me?” Raskolnikov cried. 

“He wanted to know if a student lived here,” the porter replied. 

Raskolnikov felt a chill. 

He ran after the stranger, who walked deliberately. 

Raskolnikov followed, eyes fixed on the ground. 

He caught up, but hesitated. 

What was happening?

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters a mysterious stranger who inquires about him, leaving him puzzled and anxious.
